seg.source: 俄罗斯总统普京解除谢尔盖·伊万诺夫办公厅主任职务
seg.translation: President of Russia, Putin, has relieved Sergei Ivanov of his position as the Chief of Staff of the Presidential Executive Office.
Russian President Vladimir Putin relieves Sergei Office director

seg.source: 俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京 (Vladimir Putin) 出乎意料地解除了谢尔盖·伊万诺夫 (Sergei Ivanov) 的总统办公厅主任职务。
seg.translation: Russian President Vladimir Putin dismissed Sergei Ivanov as Chief of Staff of the Presidential executive Office unexpectedly.
Vladimir Putin, Russia's president, unexpectedly relieved Sergei (Sergei Ivanov) of the presidency of the Office of the Chief of staff.
Vladimir Putin, Russia's president, unexpectedly sacked Sergei Ivanov as chief of staff to the president.

seg.source: 多年来，伊万诺夫先生一直是深得普京先生信任的核心集团的一分子。
seg.translation: For many years, Ivanov has always been a member of a core group of individuals deeply trusted by Putin.
Mr Ivanov has been a member of the core group that Mr Putin has trusted for years.
For years, Mr. Ivanov has been part of a core group that has won Mr. Putin's trust.

seg.source: 现年63岁的伊万诺夫如今已被任命为环境与交通问题特别代表。
seg.translation: Ivanov, now 63 years old, has been appointed as a special representative for environment and transportation issues.
Mr Ivanov, now 63, has been appointed Special Representative on environment and transport.
Ivanov, 63, has now been appointed special representative for the environment and transport.

seg.source: 克里姆林宫的一份声明称，普京先生已“宣布解除伊万诺夫的俄罗斯总统办公厅主任一职，”但是没有给出原因。
seg.translation: A statement from the Kremlin said that Mr Putin had “decreed to relieve Ivanov of his duties as head of the Russian presidential administration", but gave no reason.
A statement from the Kremlin said Mr. Putin had "announced the release of the Office of the Chief of the Russian president of Ivanov," but gave no reason.
A Kremlin statement said Mr. Putin had "announced the dismissal of Ivanov as chief of staff of the Russian president," without giving a reason.

seg.source: 2012年开始担任伊万诺夫先生副手的安东·瓦伊诺 (Anton Vaino) 已获任命为他的接任者。
seg.translation: Anton Vaino, who has served as Ivanov’s assistant since 2012, has been appointed as his successor.
安东·瓦伊诺 (Anton Vaino), who became deputy to Mr. Ivanov in 2012, has been appointed as his successor.
Anton Vaino, who began serving as Mr Ivanov's deputy in 2012, has been appointed as his replacement.

seg.source: 瓦伊诺先生现年44岁，是一名前外交官。
seg.translation: Mr Ivanov, 44, was a former diplomat.
Mr. Vaino, 44 years old, is a former diplomat.

seg.source: 获任命后，他对普京先生说：“谢谢您的信任。”
seg.translation: After receiving his appointment, he said to Mr Putin, “Thank you for your trust.”
After his appointment, he said to Mr Putin: "Thank you for your trust." ”

seg.translation: Putin told Russian television channels on Friday that Ivanov has resigned on his own request, and recommended Ivanov to succeed him as well.
Mr. Putin told Russian television in Friday that Mr. Ivanov himself had asked to resign and recommended Mr. Vaino to take over.
Mr. Putin told Russian television on Friday that Mr. Ivanov himself had called for his resignation and recommended Mr. Vaino to take over.

seg.translation: Can this smile convince anyone?

seg.translation: Sergei Ivanov has long been one of Vladimir Putin's closest allies and, like him, served in the Soviet security service (KGB).

seg.translation: As the Chief of Staff, he was once one of the most influential persons in the country.
As Director of the office, he was one of the most influential people in the country.

seg.translation: At a meeting with President Putin broadcast by State television, the two men said that it was the Chief of Staff himself who tendered the resignation.
At a meeting with President Putin on state television, both men said the chief executive himself had asked to resign.

seg.source: 尽管在镜头前满面笑容，可是几乎没人信服——特别是在议会选举之前的这个时候。
seg.translation: The candidate may be smiling in front of the camera, but no one is buying it, especially on the eve of local elections.

seg.translation: The official narrative however - a candidate who was previously regarded as a presidential candidate would suddenly choose to preside over Russia’s environmental policy - caused much suspicion.

seg.translation: The Kremlin website cited a conversation between Mr Ivanoc and Mr Putin. He said, “Yes, at the beginning of 2012, I did, in a conversation, ask you to appoint me to this difficult post, or you could even say, troublesome post, for a four-year period.”

seg.translation: At the end of the 1990s, when Mr Putin was the director of the Federal Security Service (FSB, formerly the National Security Agency). Mr Ivanov was appointed his deputy.

seg.translation: Other people thought that Ivanov may be able to become the President of Russia after Putin, because it is illegal in Russia to serve three consecutive terms as President.
